formalpara.title: Figure 7. Illustration of Central Limit Theorem for a skewed population of values.
formalpara.para: Panel A shows the population (highly skewed right and truncated at zero); Panels B, C, and D show distributions of the mean for sample sizes of 15, 30, and 60, respectively, as obtained through a computational sampling approach. As indicated by the x axes, the sample means are approximately 3. The y axes indicate the number of computational samples obtained for a given mean value. As would be expected, larger-sized samples give distributions that are closer to normal and have a narrower range of values.
